column2: ok! lets get started. do we need the steel wool?
I think I put that we shouldnt take it as I cant think what survival uses it might have
its not for fire lighting and isnt help against the weather
shall we put no then?
ok
so agreed no on that one, yes.
onto the axe
yes, i think it would be necessary to get fire wood
and its only xmall so not too heavy
so agreed yes
ok good
now the pistol
i think it would be necessary to scare away any bears
there are a lot of bears in northern canada!
and again, a pistol is nt that heavy.
shall we say yes?
i think i would feel we needed it on the chance we met a bear
otherwise how would we scare them off?
ok then, thats a yes.
what were your thoughts on the butter?
i would take it for presicesly that reason
only 20 kilmoetres to go, but any propvisions would be weclome over a couple of days and butter is pure energy
ok then, agreed yes
thats true but i wonder if it would get wet?
although hadnt thought about it as insulation so probably is worth taking
it it gets wet you could just leave it
so you want to put yes?
an empty cigarette lightes doesnt seem useful!?!
so thats agreed no
no i agree cant see what it would be for
i was struggling to decide on the clothes as tey are heavy but good for warmth
wear them the whole time?
i guess so. and it said it would get very cold
at night
ok, i think I put no the first time but lets put yes
the tarp is interesting as it is so large it would be heavy
yeah
i think it would be very dangerous not to take it if te nights were expected to be below freezing
and if it got tangled or was to heavy you can just leave it
theyve got to get 20 kms so its not that far even through forest
so lets take it
ok
the mao seems a must. there is no pilot int he group but air maps are very detiled so it would be useful
yep
so thats a yes then
ok good
im not sure we would need the whisky
maybe as an antiseptci but its a lot to carry
it may do, lol
but someoe needs to stay awake in case a bear comes!
ha, probably is in such a stressful situation
so thats a no
ok
if we are taking the map I guess we'll need the compass!
yes, so agreed yes then
and to finish, thereis no coneivable reason to leave chocolate behind!
a bear would eat it
true. ok so agreed on chocolate yes. shall we submit our anwsers? we arent supposed to review them i dont think
in case of emergency!
or just because there were some gun hapy folk on the plane
ok, lets do that now
ha, yes. ive never been in a small plane and its best if it's a rare occurrence
yes, good to chat
back to unpacking for me. have a good day.
I can't recall what I said last time for this but not sure what we'd use it for...
So I think no unless you have a reason to take
Ok so we agree no?
agree no.
\i think yes for this, may be helpful for eg making shelter, fire wood...
so yes, good
I think this may be too dangerous, though may need to shoot a bear, given where we are!
Only if someone would be able to use it safely.
Ok, we'll say yes.
Not sure what we could use butter for.  Unless it's for eating in this dire emergency?
ok, yes then.  If it's so cold, it won't melt.
newspaper would be handy as fire lighting and extra layer if trying to keep warm.
yes!
couldn't think of a use for lighter without fluid...
some survival expert may know of a use but I think no here.
extra clothes good idea I think - could wear them.
Wear rather than carry, I think as cold weather
I think they are definitely worth taking.
ok.
canvas useful as shelter, even if large and heavy to carry.
agreed.  must be some stronger people who could manage it.
yes, think that's best.
map only a part, but may also help as shelter as plastic.
sorry, just read sectional air map, rather than just a section.
any way, agree useful so should take.
Whisky to anaesthetise everyone?
don't think it's needed!
dangerous to have whisky and a loaded gun!
agree no.
compass useful
yes,  I agree
chocolate full of calories, so useful
bear probably more keen to eat a human!
I'm now wondering why there was a loaded pistol on the flight...
I think we only need to ubmit them.
scary thought.  Glad this is only a theoretical exercise.
ok, let's submit answers. Interesting chat!
hope you like your new home!
OK Q1 - I think  NO
that sounds good, agree
Q2  yes to the small axe
agreed on 2 then
Q3  I thought the pistol
Q4 no butter
never thought about using it to keep warm, so yes then
5 yes to newspapers as they could use them to help light fires or to lie on on the ground
yes to the lighter
yes I think so
I will let you make the suggestions about each question
agree
yes
could be useful if they encounter wet weather
agreed
agreed
you missed the map
OK leave the map
and the whisky
No 9 on my list is map, No 10 is whisky  No 11 is compass and No 12 chocolate
yes
well if they are no going far then yes but it could be useful in case they lose their way
agreed
agree, it would also help boost sugar levels to keep them going
agreed, just glad I am not one of them!
lol
bye
